Description: Jar of heavy, squat form: the vessel is monochrome in opaque lavender-purple glass with glossy surfaces. The rim is flat. The foot, exceptionally, is solid except for its central area where the mandril was in place. A considerable portion of the surface has turned white. Monochrome jars of this kind are relatively uncommon.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Nolte, ‘Die Glasgefässe in Alten Ägypten (Berlin 1968), 134, pl. XXVII, 46.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.24, p.29)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
